dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 4794 IH: Investing for Tomorrow Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit unborn children to be account beneficiaries of section 529 education savings accounts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Investing for Tomorrow Act.

section.header: Unborn children permitted to be account beneficiaries of section 529 education savings accounts

subsection.text: Section 529(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Nothing shall prevent an unborn child from being treated as a designated beneficiary or an individual under this section.

clause.text: The term unborn child means a child in utero.
The term child in utero means a member of the species homo sapiens, at any stage of development, who is carried in the womb.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to contributions made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
